alert.note: Alert for Antelope Valley; Cuyama Valley; Los Angeles County Mountains; Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Ventura County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 11 at 2:40AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON PDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Antelope Valley, Cuyama Valley, Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range, Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains and Ventura County Mountains. * WHEN...From Noon PDT today through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. In addition, there could be mud and debris flows in and around recent burn areas * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is a chance of showers and thunderstorms this afternoon through this evening. Some of these thunderstorms may produce heavy downpours with rainfall rates up to one inch per hour. Relatively weak flow aloft will cause these storms to be slow moving, increasing the threat of dangerous flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding, and in and below recent burn areas should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Antelope Valley; Cuyama Valley; Los Angeles County Mountains; Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Ventura County Mountains
